Edit this Page
Dropbox
Table of Contents
Introduction
Install the ownCloud Dropbox App
Create a Dropbox App
Create a Dropbox Share
Other Options
Using the Dropbox Share
Introduction
Connecting Dropbox to your ownCloud installation requires only a few steps. Then you can easily keep a Dropbox folder in sync with an ownCloud folder. Install the ownCloud Dropbox App
Install the External Storage Dropbox app from the ownCloud Marketplace
Click
Market
in the ownCloud web UI drop-down menu on the left side
Go to the
Storage
category
Select
External Storage: Dropbox
App
Click
INSTALL
Create a Dropbox App
Next, you need to create a Dropbox app. Create a Dropbox Share
Return to the ownCloud web interface. Then, in the drop-down list under
External storage
, select Dropbox V2. ownCloud then interacts with the Dropbox API to set up the new shared folder. Now, if you add files and folders in either the new Dropbox folder or the new ownCloud folder, they will be visible in both after they’ve been synced.

This guide assumes you already have a Dropbox account. To do that,
open the new app creation form
, where you see three settings:
"Choose an API" –> "Scoped access"
"Choose the type of access" –> "App folder"
"Name your app"
Read and agree to the Dropbox API Terms and Conditions before clicking the blue
Create app
button. Then, you need to provide a name for the folder in the "Folder name" field and a "client key" and "client secret" under "Configuration". The client key and client secret values are the "App key" and "App secret" which you saw earlier in your Dropbox app configuration settings. If the process is successful, a green circle icon appears at the far left-hand side of the row next to the folder name. Using the Dropbox Share
After a Dropbox share is created, a new folder is available under "All Files" with the name you provided when you created the share. It is represented by an external share folder icon as in the image below. This links to a new folder in your Dropbox account under
Dropbox
Apps
with the name of the Dropbox app that you created.

After you do that, the settings page for the application loads. Redirect URI
: Here you must enter the exact URL of the page where you configure the storage. Examples:
When configuring as an
admin
:
http(s)://<<Server_Address>>/settings/admin?sectionid=storage
When configuring as a
user
:
http(s)://<<Server_Address>>/settings/personal?sectionid=storage
Take note of the App key and App secret since you’ll need them in the next step. Under
Admin
Settings
Storage
, check the
Enable external storage
checkbox if it’s not already checked.

After you have entered these values, click
Grant access
. Other Options
If you want to grant access to the share to a select list of users and groups, you can add them to the field in the "Available for" column.
